availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: David Boys (Grant County and Kenton County, Kentucky, brick mason.)

body.p: Grant County and Kenton County, Kentucky, brick mason. Ohio native. Married Nancy S. Pollard Boys in Clermont, Ohio on February 19, 1837. Father of Elizabeth Boys, Orlando Boys, Turpin D. Boys, Missouri Boys, Virginia Boys, Elmore Boys, and George Boys. Brick layer in Covington, Kenton County, Kentucky in 1850. Brick mason in Williamstown, Grant County, Kentucky in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, p. 286B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Williamstown, p. 989.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Williamstown, p. 583B.
Ohio Marriage Records (1774-1993), Various Ohio County Courthouses, Clermont, Ohio, County Marriages, Film #000327560 p. 321 of 466.
Find A Grave, "David Boys (5 Feb 1814-22 Dec 1890)," Memorial #83466235, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/83466235(accessed June 5, 2020).
